contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox CanadianMP | name = '''Kevin A. Sorenson ''' | image = <!-- only free-content images are allowed for depicting living people - see [[WP:NONFREE]] --> | term_start = 2000 | term_end = | predecessor = [[Jack Ramsay (politician)|Jack Ramsay]] | birth_date = {{Birth date and age |1958|11|3}} | birth_place = [[Killam, Alberta]] | successor = | death_date = | death_place = | profession = businessman, farmer | party = [[Conservative Party of Canada|Conservative]] | party colour = Conservative | residence = [[Camrose, Alberta]] | riding = [[Crowfoot (electoral district)|Crowfoot]] | footnotes = | term_start2 = | term_end2 = | predecessor2 = | successor2 = | spouse = Darlene Sorenson | religion = }} '''Kevin A. Sorenson''' (born November 3, 1958 in [[Killam, Alberta]]) is a [[Canada|Canadian]] politician. Sorenson is a member of the [[Conservative Party of Canada]] in the [[Canadian House of Commons]], representing the riding of [[Crowfoot (electoral district)|Crowfoot]] since 2000. He has also been a member of the [[Canadian Alliance]] (2000â€“2003). He has served as the former Opposition critic to the Solicitor General, and of Public Safety and Emergency Preparedness. In January 2006, he was re-elected with 82.5 per cent of the popular vote. Sorenson is the chair of the Standing Committee on Public Safety and National Security. ==External links== *{{CanParlbio|ID=eb53bf99-e3d5-44b9-a15e-6c295470cdd4}} *[http://www.kevinsorenson.ca/ Kevin Sorenson official website] {{Canadian House of Commons Standing Committee on Foreign Affairs and International Development}} {{Current Members of the Canadian House of Commons}} {{Persondata |NAME=Sorenson, Kevin A. |ALTERNATIVE NAMES= |SHORT DESCRIPTION=Canadian politician |DATE OF BIRTH=November 3, 1958 |PLACE OF BIRTH=[[Killam, Alberta]], [[Canada]] |DATE OF DEATH=living |PLACE OF DEATH= }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sorenson, Kevin}} [[Category:1958 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Members of the House of Commons of Canada from Alberta]] [[Category:Canadian Alliance MPs]] [[Category:Conservative Party of Canada MPs]] {{Alberta-politician-stub}}
